intro: Allium vernale, commonly known as the spring onion or scallion, is a hardy herbaceous plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its hollow, cylindrical leaves and a cluster of small, spherical bulbs at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are often used in cooking, while the bulbs are harvested for culinary purposes. Allium vernale thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a versatile addition to gardens and agricultural settings.
